tool_input.command: cat .git/hooks/post-commit 2>&1; echo "---"; cat .git/hooks/prepare-commit-msg 2>&1; echo "---"; cat .git/hooks/commit-msg 2>&1; echo "---"; cat .git/hooks/pre-push 2>&1
tool_input.explanation: Read the entire-installed git hooks

tool_response:
Note: The tool simplified the command to ` cat .git/hooks/post-commit 2>&1; echo "---"; cat .git/hooks/prepare-commit-msg 2>&1; echo "---"; cat .git/hooks/commit-msg 2>&1; echo "---"; cat .git/hooks/pre-push 2>&1`, and this is the output of running that command instead:
#!/bin/sh
# Entire CLI hooks
# Post-commit hook: condense session data if commit has Entire-Checkpoint traile
r                                                                               entire hooks git post-commit 2>/dev/null || true
---
#!/bin/sh
# Entire CLI hooks
entire hooks git prepare-commit-msg "$1" "$2" 2>/dev/null || true
---
#!/bin/sh
# Entire CLI hooks
# Commit-msg hook: strip trailer if no user content (allows aborting empty commi
ts)                                                                             entire hooks git commit-msg "$1" || exit 1
---
#!/bin/sh
# Entire CLI hooks
# Pre-push hook: push session logs alongside user's push
# $1 is the remote name (e.g., "origin")
entire hooks git pre-push "$1" || true
